channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Surface drain blocked, 9th November
item.description:
Surface drain blocked with debris and leaves so water drains away very slowly leaving large amount of standing water on road after heavy rain. Just by traffic island opposite Willoughby.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Suffolk Square, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 9th November
item.description:
email rcvd 07.11.23 - Hello, I'm mailing as we have a rather lovely tree outside our house at 18 Glencairn Park Rd, Cheltenham GL50 2ND but some of the branches have grown a lot this year and are now resting on electricity/telephone wires. With high winds forecast I'm concerned they may cause a problem. I've attached some images for you. Could you come and take a look/prune the tree back a bit? Thank you. Very best,
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked drain outside 104 Fairview Rd, 9th November
item.description:
This drain has been blocked for a long time. It has been reported previously but no action taken. It often emits a very unpleasant odour as well as the blockage, which results in flooding further down the street.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 106, Fairview Road, Fairview, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Right turn filter needed, 9th November
item.description:
Driving northwest on A435 to turn right into Hewlett Road there is no right turn filter. The lights turn red before you have chance to turn right because of oncoming traffic. This means that you have to drive through a red light or sit there forever! Needs a right turn filter light please.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Waterfield Close, Naunton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Filter light needed, 9th November
item.description:
Driving south on Bath Road to turn right into A40 there is no right turn filter. The lights turn red before you have chance to turn right because of oncoming traffic. This means that you have to drive through a red light or sit there forever! Needs a right turn filter light please.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Waterfield Close, Naunton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Langley Brook is running out onto Langley Road due to blockage of underground pipe.The road is impassable for local residents., 9th November
item.description:
Between Cockbury Willows and Cockbury Butts Farm. The blocked pipe/drain passes under the road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Langley Road, Southam, Tewkesbury

item.title: Floodlights shining through bedroom window, 9th November
item.description:
The floodlights are on the new housing development that is being built opposite. However due to some recent thefts they have put up some floodlights. These lights shine through my daughter’s bedroom window and are keeping her awake at night. If they were turned slightly it wouldn’t be so bad but they are directly shining through the window.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hayden Road, Springbank, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 9th November
item.description:
email rcvd 07.11.23 - Hello, I wish to report that there are a row of conifers from the front garden of a property which are encroaching onto the footway alongside the brook on Wymans Brook (they take up over half of the footpath). This necessitates an uncomfortable walk along this bit as your feet are on an angle and you will need to go single file (not ideal if you are pushing a pram and holding another child’s hand). Would it be possible for the owner of the property to trim them back ? I think they are outside number 28 Yew Tree Close (the row that fronts onto the brook itself). Many thanks for your help
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Branches/tree overhanging into road, 9th November
item.description:
The tree is just as the bend starts, driving up from Templefields. It’s easy for large vehicles to hit if they’re unaware.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Gloucester Road, Andoversford, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Tree causing damage/obstruction to pavement or road

item.title: Parking now worse due to road markings, 9th November
item.description:
Fairview street recently had the new Z permit parking installed, with the idea being that this would make parking on the road easier for residents. However due to the apalling use of road markings and increased double yellow lines it is now harder to park. The dedicated spaces marked on the road are big not big enough for the amount of cars on the road, so I often find I am parking elsewhee on roads that I dont pay to park on. It is obviously the council trying to make money off residents by buying permits, which everyone knows, but the lack of benefit from this is appalling. Please reconsider the parking lines and remove the unecessary extended double yellows on the road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 64, Fairview Street, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road marking and stud issues

item.title: Red light not working., 9th November
item.description:
The red light on the traffic light at the exit of North Upton Lane into Barnwood Road/Hucclecote Road has not been working for several weeks now. I'm surprised that there is no option to select for that problem as surely a non-operational red light is far more dangerous than a non-operational amber or green. For that reason I had to select 'vandalised' in order to report it.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): North Upton Lane, Hucclecote, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: The traffic light has been vandalised

item.title: Loose/rattling cover/ironwork problem, 9th November
item.description:
FMS rcvd 06.11.23 - Drainage ditch silted up. The drainage ditch alongside the lane leading down to Manor Barn is completely silted up and blocked. This is a routine maintenance requirement which has been accepted by Gloucestershire Highways. In light of the heavy rain, the ditch needs to be cleared as a priority, and maintained.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drains on station road adj Churchdown village junior school, 9th November
item.description:
The two lower drains of the group of three were rapidly overwhelmed in light rain while adjacent drains were draining correctly suggesting partial or complete blockage.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Station Road, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple deep pothole, 9th November
item.description:
Multiple large deep potholes over a hundred yard section of Butts Lane. One large pothole had been there for a year. Many more smaller, but deep, potholes have developed over the last few months.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Butt's Lane, Woodmancote, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
